kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_1: The Brazier is a Multiblock structure used to prevent monsters from spawning in a large radius around it.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_10: So let's make it taller to increase that!
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_11: Now it'll stop spawns in a larger radius!
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_12: To be exact, it'll get a circular radius increase of 10 Blocks per layer.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_13: And the limit for its height is 10 Layers, which is a whopping 100 Block radius!
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_2: Let's start by going over how to build its structure.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_3: The Brazier has two categories of Blocks that are used for its structure.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_4: The "Stripe" Blocks, which can be Ancient Debris or Netherite Blocks...
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_5: ... and the "Base" Blocks, which can be Gilded Blackstone or Crying Obsidian
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_6: The Stripes go in Cardinal directions from the center, as seen.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_7: While the Bases cover everything else, except the corners, those are ignored.
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_8: Once the Brazier lights, that means it's active!
kubejs.ponder.brazier.text_9: ... But it'll have a pretty limited range like this...
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_1: A Seared Drain is where the Fluids inside of the Smeltery can be interfaced with.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_10: Applying a Redstone Signal to a Faucet will cause it to begin casting.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_11: This sequence has been accelerated for your viewing pleasure.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_12: As long as Redstone is still applied when the Casted Item is removed, the Faucet will continue Casting.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_2: The most common way to extract them is a Seared Faucet.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_3: Seared Faucets can pour Fluids from the Smeltery into things placed beneath them.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_4: Most Importantly, Casting Tables and Basins.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_5: Casting Tables are most often used to cast Ingots and Tool Parts from Molten Metals in the Smeltery.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_6: While Casting Basins are often used to cast Blocks from Metals in the Smeltery.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_7: Casting Tables often require a Cast for Molten fluids to Cool in.
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_8: To Pour Fluids out of a Seared Faucet, simply Interact with it
kubejs.ponder.casting.text_9: Casting can also be automated from Faucets using Redstone.
kubejs.ponder.mek_fission.text_1: Looking for some big power? Or maybe just special Resources? Fission Reactors have you covered!
kubejs.ponder.mek_fission.text_2: Let's get the Building Rules down with the Bottom layer.
kubejs.ponder.mek_fusion.text_1: So, you want to build a Fusion Reactor to get all the energy in the world?
kubejs.ponder.mek_fusion.text_2: We'll start by getting down the Building rules with the Bottom layer.
kubejs.ponder.mek_fusion.text_3: A Fusion Reactor can be made of any combination of Fusion Reactor Casing, Ports, Logic Adapters, Laser Focus Matrixes and Reactor Glass.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_1: The Supercritical Phase Shifter is a Multiblock used to create Antimatter.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_10: Supercharged Coils do not need to be placed on the Walls, nor be aligned with the center of the Structure.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_11: Now all you need to do is pipe in your Polonium, provide a load of Energy, and get out your Antimatter!
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_2: Let's start by making the Bottom layer.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_3: The SPS can be made of any combination of SPS Casing, Ports, and Structural Glass
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_4: However, the Edges must be composed of only SPS Casing.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_5: A Configurator can be used to change a Port's mode
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_6: The other Sides of the structure follow the same rules as the Bottom.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_7: Now, Let's move on to those sides, and other mechanics of the SPS.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_8: Supercharged Coils must be placed on a Port to let it accept Energy.
kubejs.ponder.mek_sps.text_9: Ports with Supercharged Coils attached can still be used to Input and Output Chemical products.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_1: So, you want to build a Smeltery to Melt things down and Cast them out? Then let's go over the basics.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_10: As for the Smeltery's main purpose, Melting items down.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_11: You can add items to melt either through the Smeltery Controller's interface, physically dropping them inside of it, or feeding them in through a Seared Chute
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_12: ...Oh yeah, it'll also need some kind of Fuel to heat up the contents.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_13: Lava is your first available Fuel for it.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_15: The Smeltery's height can also be increased by adding more Layers.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_16: This will increase its Capacity for Fluids and Items, but cause it to consume Fuel faster.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_2: The Smeltery is composed primarily of different Seared Blocks.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_3: First, the Bottom layer of it can be any Rectangular shape, and must be made of any regular Seared block.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_4: We'll use a 3x3 base in this example.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_5: Higher layers of the Smeltery can use other Seared blocks.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_7: Every Smeltery requires a Smeltery Controller...
kubejs.ponder.smeltery.text_9: ...and atleast one Seared Drain to access its contents.
kubejs.ponder.vampire_portal.text_1: Looking for a Vampire Forest? It's contained solely within a custom Dimension in MC Eternal 2.
kubejs.ponder.vampire_portal.text_3: First, create a ring of Deepslate Bricks.
kubejs.ponder.vampire_portal.text_4: Then, use either a full Blood Bottle or Vampire Blood on each brick.
kubejs.ponder.vampire_portal.text_5: Then, just click anywhere inside the frame with Vampire Blood!
